alert.note: Alert for Wabasha (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 11:13AM CDT until further notice by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Minnesota... Mississippi River at Wabasha affecting Wabasha and Buffalo Counties. .Anomalous warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack across northern and western Minnesota and northern Wisconsin today. This will result in increase river flows along the Mississippi River. Moderate flooding is expected along the Mississippi River at Wabasha, MN. ne the river is forecast to crest between 14 and 15 feet on April 20- ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Wabasha. * WHEN...From Friday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Lock and Dam 4 goes out of operation and damages may begin to occur in Alma Wisconsin. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 11.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening and continue rising to 14.9 feet early Thursday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.4 feet on 06/30/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1045 PM CDT.
